settings.heading: Personalized Doula Care for Pregnancy and Beyond

settings.text: Pregnancy is an incredible journey. My compassionate and holistic approach is centered around what you want: Safety, Comfort, Positivity and Empowerment!

custom_css: @media screen and (min-width: 749px) {.banner__content > div {border-radius: 16px; backdrop-filter: blur(3px); -webkit-backdrop-filter: blur(3px); }}

settings.text:
It can also be filled with uncertainty, stress and fear of the unknown.

You may feel overwhelmed by the changes, decisions and responsibilities that come with this new stage in life.

As your dedicated doula, I am with you for the entire transformation: from the anticipation of pregnancy to the joy of having your newborn in your arms.

I am an experienced navigator in the landscape of pregnancy, childbirth, and postpartum care and align my care with your lifestyle and values every step of the way.

Think of me as your guide and steadfast support through every step of the way. You are not alone!

settings.heading: Initial Complimentary Consultations
settings.row_content:
Free consultation to discuss you needs and preferences so that we can ensure a compatible fit.

Contact Me to receive a booking link

settings.heading: Prenatal Care
settings.row_content:
Before your estimated due date, we’ll have prenatal visits together to get you ready and feeling great!

During these visits, we'll...

  • Build our connection
  • Discuss your birth preferences
  • Create a Birth Plan
  • Practice relaxation techniques in our Labor Prep class
  • Talk about comfort measures and labor positions
  • Provide tips on laboring at home

These visits are designed to help you get ready for your baby, address any questions or concerns you may have, and ensure you feel prepared and confident for your upcoming birth experience.

Wondering what we'll cover? Check out our Planning Checklist filled with topics we can explore together.

Contact Me >

settings.heading: 24/7 On-Call Support
settings.row_content:
As your doula, I am here for you 24/7 with on-call availability starting at 38 weeks gestation and continuing through your entire pregnancy, birth, and postpartum period.

You can count on me to be there whenever you need help, whether it's answering questions, providing guidance, or offering support during labor and beyond.

With on-call availability, you can have peace of mind knowing that I are just a call or message away, ready to provide the support you need whenever you need it most.

After contacting me at the onset of labor, I will be constantly available via phone, video call, and text to provide support as you labor before they meet you at home or at your preferred delivery location through the duration of labor.

Contact Me >

settings.heading: Birth Support
settings.row_content:
As your doula, I will be by your side throughout labor, providing continuous support, encouragement, and comfort, regardless of your chosen birth location (home, birthing center, or hospital). My services include:

  • Rebozo Massage: Utilizing the traditional Mexican technique of using a shawl-like cloth, I will provide gentle and soothing movements to help ease tension and promote relaxation during labor.
  • Birthing Ball: I will assist you in using a birthing ball, a large inflatable ball, as a tool for comfort, support, and optimal positioning during labor.
  • Breathing Techniques: I will guide you through various breathing techniques to help you stay relaxed, focused, and manage pain during labor.
  • Complimentary Birth Photography and Video: As a special gift to you, I will capture precious moments of your labor and birth through photography and video, which will be provided to you on a flash drive to treasure for a lifetime.
  • Birth Room Ambiance: I will create a calming and soothing environment in your birth room with a Himalayan salt lamp, essential oil diffuser, sweet orange mist, and arnica massage oil to promote relaxation and comfort during labor.

With my comprehensive support through labor, you can feel confident that you own this transformative experience.

Contact Me >

settings.heading: Postpartum Meetings
settings.row_content:
As your doula, I am here to support you during the postpartum period, meeting you where you're at and from the comfort of your own home. I am here to listen to you, whether it's about the challenges or joys of adjusting to life with a newborn.

I offer:

  • In-Home Visits: Within the first two weeks postpartum, we will schedule visits to your home, providing emotional support, practical assistance, and answering any questions you may have about the birth experience or newborn care.
  • Emotional Support: I am here to listen and provide a safe space for you to share your feelings, emotions, and thoughts about adjusting to life with a new baby, whether it's the good, the bad, or the tough stuff.
  • Resources and Tips on Infant Feeding: I will provide valuable resources and tips on infant feeding, including breastfeeding, bottle-feeding, and introducing solids, to help you navigate this important aspect of newborn care.
  • Meal Planning and Grocery Lists: I will help you plan nourishing postpartum meals and provide a grocery list to make your life a little easier during the postpartum period. We can also arrange contact-free drop-off of needed items through community support, a meal train, or assistance from friends and family.
  • Ongoing Postpartum Care: As your doula, I understand that postpartum care extends beyond the initial weeks with a newborn. I am committed to providing ongoing support to new parents, those with toddlers, or multiple children through simple acts of caring for the parent, while you care for your family.

Your postpartum visits are designed to meet you where you're at, from the comfort of your home, and provide comprehensive support to help you navigate the early weeks of parenthood with confidence and ease.

Contact Me >

settings.heading: Customized Resources and Referrals
settings.row_content: Personalized resources and referrals, including coordinating with other professionals such as personal trainers, nutritionists, lactation consultants, or postpartum therapists as needed.

settings.caption: Birth Doula Services that guide and support you through every stage
settings.heading: I provide education and resources during pregnancy, continuous support throughout labor, and postpartum assistance to help you transition smoothly into parenthood.

settings.text: Reach out today to ensure that you have an empowering and positive birth experience.

settings.heading: Avoid feeling isolated, overwhelmed and unsupported during this crucial time

settings.text: Doulas are your village! Doula work is care work and I support your ideas and concerns, judgement-free.

settings.heading: Have a beautiful and rewarding journey

settings.text:
With my holistic support, you will feel confident and prepared throughout your pregnancy, during labor, and in the postpartum period.

You'll have a trusted guide by your side helping you navigate each new experience and challenge. I am here for you!

settings.heading: Begin Your Parenting Journey with Confidence and Joy

settings.text: You'll transition from feeling overwhelmed by the uncertainties of parenthood to feeling secure, proud and connected with your baby.

settings.heading: What's the difference between Doulas and Midwives? Do doulas deliver babies?
settings.row_content: Doulas are birth professionals that can work alongside midwives and doctors alike. In hospitals, birth centers and homes, we do our work “from the hips up”, that is to say doulas are here for your mental, emotional, and physical support focusing only on the immediate needs of the birthing person and their chosen partner to aid in the labor process and postpartum.

settings.heading: What kind of births do you support? Do you only support natural births?
settings.row_content:
All births are natural!

Really, birth is a natural occurrence so we support any and every type of birth and birthing body. No matter if you want-no drugs or all the drugs, we will be there cheering you on and celebrating your choices.

“I do not care what kind of birth you have… a home birth, scheduled cesarean, epidural hospital birth, or if you birth alone in the woods next to a baby deer. I care that you are supported in your choices, and that you were respected”

- January Harshe, Birth Without Fear

settings.heading: Do doulas have any breastfeeding or lactation training?
settings.row_content: Yes we do! Doulas receive lactation training and can assist in coaching, feeding positions, developing a good latch, nutritional information, using a pump and how to navigate a feeding schedule. Our training is focused on the immediate postpartum and setting up good feeding habits early, we also have a great reference list for lactation consultants if you would like extended assistance.

settings.heading: Should I hire a doula?
settings.row_content:
Having a doula on your labor team can mean:

  • fewer medical interventions during labor (less likely to have any pain medication, continuous electronic fetal monitoring, epidurals, vacuum or forceps-assisted births, and Cesareans)
  • increased release of natural oxytocin
  • more attention or hands on support than is reasonable for one partner or labor nurse to provide over an extended period of time
  • shorter labor, by about 40 minutes!

*Research from Cochrane Database Syst Rev. 2017

settings.heading: Should I have a doula if I have a partner?
settings.row_content:
We could never replace the connection between you and your partner.

Doulas do more than assist the birthing person through labor, we support the partner through encouragement and by helping them to feel they have all the tools, knowledge and strength to support you through the process and to take as active a role they feel comfortable with.

Your doula and partner will work together to form a birth team, wholly invested in making you comfortable and getting baby Earthside.

settings.heading: Is it really possible to birth without pain medication?
settings.row_content:
YES, YES, YES!

You absolutely are capable of having a medication-free labor and your doula will support you throughout the experience. 

There have been many studies that show continuous support leads to better labor outcomes. I highly recommend visiting my Evidence-Based Birth blog for numerous eye-opening reads.

Doulas themselves are a form of pain relief. Studies show the constant reassuring presence of a doula greatly reduces stress levels and clients are less likely to request pain medication. We also rely on many forms of homeopathic medicine that have been traditionally used by midwives for centuries; medicine that has practical use today! We trust in the wisdom of the women before us and do our research to find medication-free pain relief that is safe, effective, and reliable.

settings.text:
We already know that having someone there for you, cheering you on, believing in your choices feels really, really good—but here’s some science to back it up…

  • Doulas are a form of pain relief—requests for pain medication goes down 10% with a doula present
  • Doulas boost self-confidence—15% increase in spontaneous birth and shorter labor by 45 minutes on average
  • Doulas encourage advocacy + increase safety—34% fewer negative experiences

settings.heading: Doula Care for a Confident and Empowered Birth

settings.text:
For many women, the idea of giving birth can be a source of fear, anxiety, and doubt.

At Cliffrose Doula Care, we believe that every woman deserves to feel empowered and confident throughout the birthing process.

That's why we offer a range of classes and resources designed to provide you with the tools you need to achieve a beautiful birth and postpartum experience. Don't leave your birth to chance – join us today and take the first step towards a more positive and fulfilling birth experience.
